he sinusoidal pattern is a regular, smooth, undulating signal, resembling a sine wave, with an amplitude of
5–15 bpm, and a frequency of 3–5 cycles per minute. This pattern lasts more than 30 minutes.
o The presence of this pattern must prompt discussion with a senior doctor, who should exclude the possible
c
auses, all of which are serious.
o In placental abruption, with loss of variability and late decelerations following one after the other, the pattern
may have a sinusoidal appeara
